content: The thing I love most about X is the real-time nature of it. Breaking news happens here first, often by minutes or hours before traditional media picks it up.
Grok 2 is coming soon. It will be significantly more capable with improved reasoning and real-time information access. The future of AI assistants is here.
The xAI team is building something special. Grok 2 will have multimodal capabilities and much better reasoning. Stay tuned for announcements.
SpaceX Starship is the key to making humanity multiplanetary. The engineering challenges are immense but solvable.
Tesla FSD is getting better every week. Neural networks learning from billions of miles of real-world driving data.
AI will be the most transformative technology in human history. We need to get it right. Safety and capability must advance together.
The pace of AI progress is incredible. GPT-5 is going to be a significant leap forward. We're working hard on making it both more capable and safer.
The best founders I know are unreasonably optimistic about the future while being incredibly realistic about the present.
AGI is closer than most people think. The question isn't if, but when and how we ensure it benefits everyone.
OpenAI's mission is to ensure AGI benefits all of humanity. That's why safety research is at our core.
The hottest new programming language is English. With LLMs, you can now describe what you want in plain language and get working code.
LLMs are essentially knowledge compression algorithms. They compress the internet into a model that can generate relevant outputs.
Just launched a new YouTube series on building LLMs from scratch. Start with tokenizers, then transformers, then training at scale.
The best way to learn deep learning is to implement everything from scratch. Understanding beats memorization.
Transformers are beautiful. Attention is all you need. But there's still so much room for architectural innovation.
The most important skill for getting rich is becoming a perpetual learner. You have to know how to learn anything you want to learn.
AI won't replace humans, but humans using AI will replace humans not using AI. Learn to leverage these tools or get left behind.
Seek wealth, not money or status. Wealth is having assets that earn while you sleep.
Play long-term games with long-term people. Compound interest applies to relationships too.
Specific knowledge is found by pursuing your genuine curiosity and passion rather than whatever is hot right now.
The best startup ideas are things the founders want for themselves. The reason is simple: if you want something, there's a good chance others do too.
The best essays are explorations, not presentations. You start with a question and see where it leads. That's why writing is thinking.
Startups don't die from competition. They die from suicide. Most startups fail because founders give up or can't work together.
Do things that don't scale. That's how you learn what customers actually want.
The way to get startup ideas is not to think of startup ideas. It's to look for problems, preferably problems you have yourself.
Auto-regressive LLMs are not the path to AGI. We need architectures that can plan, reason about the physical world, and have persistent memory.
The future of AI is not just about larger models. We need new paradigms: world models, hierarchical planning, and energy-based learning.
Self-supervised learning is the future. Humans learn mostly from observation, not from labeled examples.
JEPA (Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture) is our path forward. Predict in representation space, not pixel space.
AI safety concerns about superintelligence are overblown. We should focus on near-term issues like bias and misinformation.
Introducing GPT-4 Turbo with 128k context window. Now available in the API. Build more powerful applications with longer context and improved performance.
We're releasing a new safety evaluation framework. Understanding AI capabilities and risks is essential for responsible development.
ChatGPT now has voice mode for all users. Have natural conversations with your AI assistant.
Our latest research on interpretability: understanding what neural networks learn internally.
The GPT Store is now live. Discover custom GPTs built by the community for every use case.
Grok is now available to all X Premium subscribers! Ask Grok anything - it has real-time access to information via the X platform and web search.
Grok now has image understanding capabilities. Upload images and ask questions about them. Available to all X Premium subscribers.
Our mission: understand the true nature of the universe. AI is our tool for exploration.
Grok was trained on real-time data from X, giving it unique insights into current events and trends.
We're hiring! Join us to work on the next generation of AI systems. Passion for truth and curiosity required.
The best conversations I've had are with people who disagree with me but are willing to explore ideas together. That's how we grow.
Just finished an amazing 4-hour conversation with Geoffrey Hinton about the future of AI, consciousness, and the existential risks we face.
Love is the answer to most questions. Including the hard ones about AI and the future of humanity.
Train hard. Be humble. Stay curious. That's the path to mastery in any field.
New podcast episode with Demis Hassabis on AlphaFold, AGI timelines, and the future of DeepMind. Link in bio.
AlphaFold has now predicted structures for every known protein. This will accelerate drug discovery and our understanding of biology.
Gemini Ultra is our most capable model yet. Multimodal reasoning across text, code, images, and audio.
The Nobel Prize in Chemistry for AlphaFold is recognition of AI's potential to solve fundamental scientific problems.
We need AI that can reason, plan, and understand the world. That's what we're building at DeepMind.
Games have been our training ground for AGI. From Go to StarCraft, each breakthrough taught us something new about intelligence.
Excited to share our latest research on scaling laws for neural networks. Bigger isn't always better - efficiency matters.
TPU v5 is now available. Purpose-built hardware for machine learning continues to push the boundaries of what's possible.
The combination of large models and efficient inference is key to deploying AI at scale. We're making progress on both fronts.
Two decades at Google and I'm still excited to come to work every day. The problems we're solving keep getting more interesting.
MapReduce was just the beginning. The infrastructure we're building now for AI will transform computing once again.
The secret to AGI is in the data. We need to understand what it means to learn from everything.
Scaling is not a law, it's an observation. We need to understand why it works to know when it will stop.
Alignment is the most important problem in AI. I'm dedicating my work to ensuring AI benefits humanity.
Prediction is compression. And compression is understanding. That's why language models are so powerful.
The goal is not to build AI that passes tests. It's to build AI that understands reality.
Kaggle competitions have trained a generation of ML practitioners. Hands-on experience beats theory every time.
The best data scientists I know are curious about everything. They see patterns where others see noise.
Intelligence is not about memory or pattern matching. It's about generalization and adaptation to novel situations.
Keras 3.0 is now multi-backend. Use the same code with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX. Developer experience matters.
The ARC benchmark measures intelligence, not memorization. LLMs still struggle with it despite their size.
Deep learning will not give us AGI. We need new ideas about what intelligence actually is.
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication in software design. Keras embodies this philosophy.
GANs opened a new chapter in generative AI. But diffusion models showed us there are many paths to the same goal.
Adversarial examples remain a fundamental challenge. Robustness and capability are both essential.
The best research ideas come from understanding what doesn't work and asking why.
NLP has come so far. From rule-based systems to transformers, each era taught us something fundamental about language.
Understanding language requires understanding the world. That's why multimodal AI is so important.
AI is finally becoming useful for everyone, not just researchers. That was always the goal.
Search is being transformed by AI. Natural language understanding changes how we find information.
World models are the key to efficient learning. Imagine the outcome before taking action.
Reinforcement learning in imagination is how we'll build truly adaptive agents.
Evolution gave us general intelligence. We need to understand why to replicate it.
Robotics is the ultimate test of AI. The real world doesn't forgive errors like simulations do.
Foundation models for robotics will change manufacturing. General-purpose robots are coming.
Learning from demonstration is powerful but limited. We need robots that can truly adapt.
Offline RL is changing how we train policies. Learn from data without risky exploration.
Robot learning at scale is finally possible. Large datasets of robot experience are the key.
Meta-learning teaches models to learn. That's closer to how humans generalize from few examples.
Robots that can learn new tasks from a single demonstration. That's the goal of few-shot imitation.
AI safety is not about stopping progress. It's about making progress in the right direction.
Constitutional AI is how we teach models to be helpful, harmless, and honest. Principles matter.
Claude 3 represents our best efforts at building AI that's both capable and aligned with human values.
Prompt engineering is an art. The right words can unlock capabilities you didn't know the model had.
Red teaming AI models reveals their weaknesses. You have to think like an adversary to build safe systems.
Chain-of-thought prompting unlocked reasoning in LLMs. Sometimes the right question is more important than the right model.
Emergent abilities appear suddenly as models scale. That's what makes AI research so exciting.
AI is changing how we work, learn, and create. The productivity gains are real and measurable.
The best use of AI is augmenting human creativity, not replacing it. Collaboration is the key.
Students using AI learn differently. We need to rethink education for the AI era.
The alignment problem is not just technical. It's philosophical. What do we really want AI to do?
AI systems should be uncertain about human preferences. That uncertainty makes them safer.
The future of AI depends on the decisions we make today. There's no time to waste on AI safety.
Beneficial AI is possible. But it requires intentional effort and global cooperation.
AI regulation needs to happen before it's too late. We should be proactive, not reactive.
2024 was an incredible year for AI. 2025 will be even more transformative. We're just getting started.
